alert.note: Alert for Manua; Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu (American Samoa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS American Samoa (Pago Pago, American Samoa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 12:24PM SST by NWS American Samoa
info.description: ...Minor Coastal Flooding during Peak High Tide through Wednesday... Higher than normal high tides, also known as king tides are expexted from July 31 through August 3 for the full moon on August 1. These tides can cause isolated minor coastal flooding, especially in vulnerable low-lying coastal roadways, docks, boat ramps, marina and other coastal infrastructure for the American Samoa Islands. Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and be aware of over wash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Please submit any coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org OR call the Weather Service Office at 699-9130. High Tides at Pago Pago Harbor Mon 623 PM 2.8 FT Tue 642 AM 3.4 FT Tue 716 PM 2.91 FT Wed 736 AM 3.5 FT Wed 809 PM 3.0 FT High Tides at Tau Harbor Mon 558 PM 3.98 FT Tue 618 AM 4.91 FT Tue 651 PM 4.16 FT Wed 711 AM 4.96 FT Wed 744 PM 4.28 FT
